header_summary:
The debate on updating BIP 21 to include Segwit and Taproot addresses highlights a shift towards modernizing Bitcoin payment URIs to support these advanced addressing methods and lightning payment instructions. A [GitHub pull request](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1555) details the proposed changes, aiming to document current practices and ensure the specification keeps pace with transaction technology advancements without hindering existing wallet functionality.

Peter Todd's discussion on the technical challenges of blockchain data storage emphasizes the need for a balance between file system compatibility and efficient data management. His insights, available on his [website](https://petertodd.org), explore the complexities of selecting numerical values for blockchain operations to avoid file system limitations and directory overcrowding.

In efforts to enhance transaction privacy, the focus on Partially Signed Bitcoin Transactions (PSBT) seeks to optimize proof generation and verification by validating the authenticity of each input. This approach proposes a reduction in computational and data requirements for secure and private transactions. Meanwhile, the [Bitcoin Layers](https://www.bitcoinlayers.org/) project, spearheaded by Janusz, aims to categorize and assess risks associated with L2s and sidechains through a comprehensive risk framework, encouraging community feedback for continuous refinement.

The announcement of Bitcoin Core version v27.1rc1 marks a significant step towards finalizing the software's next update. The release notes and source code are available for community testing, with an emphasis on identifying potential issues through [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues). This process underscores the importance of community participation in ensuring the stability and functionality of future Bitcoin Core releases.

recent_posts.title: How was the average size of blk*.data chosen?
recent_posts.summary:

- Balancing file size and number is essential to avoid system performance degradation.

- "Prefix-intersection merging" offers an optimized transaction grouping method, enhancing feerate.
